0_Nisan.0: These are the days on which one is not allowed to fast, and on some of them it is not permitted to mourn.
0_Nisan.1: From [on] the 1st [until the 8th] of Nisan was established the Daily offering,- mourning is forbidden.
0_Nisan.3: From the 8th thereof until the close of the festival (of Passover) a holiday (of a week) was declared during which it is forbidden to mourn.

1_Iyar.0: On the 7th of Iyyar was the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, and it is forbidden to mourn thereon.
1_Iyar.2: On the 14th thereof (was slaughtered) the Minor Passover, on which it is forbidden to mourn.
1_Iyar.4: On the 23rd thereof the garrison departed from Jerusalem.
1_Iyar.6: On the 27th thereof was discontinued payment of the tribute (from Judah and Jerusalem).

2_Sivan.0: On the 14th of Sivan the tower of the Fort was captured.
2_Sivan.2: On the 15th and 16th thereof the people of Bethshean {Scythopolis} and the valley were exiled.
2_Sivan.4: On the 25th thereof the publicans were removed from Judah and Jerusalem.

3_Tammuz.0: On the 4th (10th) of Tammuz the book of decrees was removed (on which it is not allowed to mourn).

4_Av.0: On the 15th of Ab, the day of Xylophoria, it is forbidden to mourn.
4_Av.4: On the 24th thereof we returned to our Law.

5_Elul.0: On the 7th of Elul was the day of the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, on which it is forbidden to mourn.
5_Elul.2: On the 17th thereof the Romans evacuated Judah and Jerusalem.
5_Elul.4: On the 22nd thereof we began to slay the wicked.

6_Tishrei.0: On the 3rd of Tishri were removed the 'mentions' on documents.

7_Cheshvan.0: On the 23rd of Heshvan the Sorega was torn away from the 'Azarah.
7_Cheshvan.2: On the 25th thereof the wall of Samaria was captured.
7_Cheshvan.4: On the 27th thereof they began again to bring the offerings of fine flour upon the altar.

8_Kislev.0: On the 3rd of Kislev the ensigns were removed from the Court.
8_Kislev.4: On the 21st thereof was the day of Mt. Gerizim (on which it is not allowed to mourn).
8_Kislev.6: On the 25th thereof is the day of Hanukkah: eight days it is forbidden to mourn.

9_Tevet.0: On the 28th of Tebeth the Sanhedrin sat in judgement.

10_Shevat.0: On the (7th) [2nd] of Shebat is a holiday, whereon it is not allowed to mourn.
10_Shevat.3: On the 22nd thereof the work on what the enemy commanded to bring into the Temple was stopped; not allowed to mourn.
10_Shevat.5: On the 28th thereof Antiochus (the king) departed from Jerusalem.

11_Adar.0: The 8th and 9th of Adar they supplicated and sounded blasts for rain.
11_Adar.2: On the 12th thereof is the day of Tyrian.
11_Adar.4: On the 13th thereof is the day of Nicanor.
11_Adar.6: On the 14th and 15th thereof (are the days of) Purim, on which it is not allowed to mourn.
11_Adar.8: On the 16th thereof was begun the building of the wall of Jerusalem; it is forbidden to mourn thereon.
11_Adar.10: On the 17th thereof the Gentiles arose against the refugees of (?) Sepphoris in the province of Chalcis and in Beth Zabdain, but there came salvation (to the Jews).
11_Adar.12: On the 20th thereof the people fasted for rain (and it descended).
11_Adar.14: On the 28th thereof the glad tidings reached the Jews that they were not to be restrained from the study of the Law. It is not permitted to mourn thereon.
